summary: An email from attorney Lilly Ann Sanchez to an unnamed recipient apologizing for her handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter, stating she was trying to protect 'the Office' and not offend the recipient. The email includes a standard legal confidentiality notice.

keyFacts: Attorney Lilly Ann Sanchez apologized to an unnamed recipient for her handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter in March 2008.
Sanchez stated her actions were motivated by trying to 'protect the Office,' not to offend the recipient.
The email suggests internal tensions or disagreements among legal professionals regarding the handling of the Epstein case.
The recipient of the email is not named, indicating a redacted or confidential relationship.
